revised_title: Influence of Venous Pressure, Arterial Pressure, and Pulse Rate on the Work Done by the Heart
tldr: The authors investigate the maximum volume of blood sent out by the left ventricle in a single beat and the influence of variations in venous pressure, arterial pressure, and pulse rate on the work done by the heart. They find that the work done by the heart increases with venous pressure and decreases with a diminished pulse rate.
